Class Position

java.lang.Object
position.Position
public class Position extends Object
Represents a position on the chess board using row and column indices. Row 0 corresponds to rank 8 (black's back rank), and row 7 corresponds to rank 1 (white's back rank). Column 0 corresponds to file A, and column 7 corresponds to file H.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jacob Sierra and Robert Zamora

    • Position

      public Position(int row, int col)
      Constructs a Position with the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index (0-7)
      col - the column index (0-7)

  • Method Details

    • fromString

      public static Position fromString(String pos)
      Creates a Position from algebraic notation (e.g., "E2"). Note: This method is redundant with Utilities.notationToPosition().
      Parameters:
      pos - the position in algebraic notation (e.g., "A1", "H8")
      Returns:
      a Position object corresponding to the notation

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Converts this Position to algebraic notation (e.g., "E2").
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the position in algebraic notation

      Compares this Position with another object for equality.

      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to compare with
      Returns:
